t: Jeremiah 49
Prophecies against Ammon
About*p the Ammonites, this is what the Lord*s says: Does*pn Israel have no sons? Is*ln he without an heir? Why*ln then has Milcom dispossessed Gad and*ln his people settled in their cities?

Therefore*ln look, the days are coming— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — when*pn I will make the shout of battle heard against*ln Rabbah of the Ammonites. It*ln will become a desolate mound, and*ln its surrounding villages will be set on fire. Israel*ln will dispossess their dispossessors, says*ln the Lord.*s

Wail,*ln Heshbon, for Ai is devastated; cry*ln out, daughters of Rabbah! Clothe*ln yourselves with sackcloth, and lament; run*ln back and forth within your walls, because*ln Milcom will go into exile together*ln with his priests and officials.
Why*ln do you boast about your valleys, your*ln flowing valley, you*ln faithless daughter — you*ln who trust in your treasures and*ln say, “Who can attack me?”

Look,*ln I am about to bring terror on you— this*lg is the declaration of the Lord God*s of Armies — from*pn all those around you. You*ln will be banished, each person headlong, with*ln no one to gather up the fugitives.
But*ln after that, I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Prophecies against Edom
About*p Edom, this is what the Lord*s of Armies says: Is*pn there no longer wisdom in Teman? Has*ln counsel perished from the prudent? Has*ln their wisdom rotted away?
Run!*ln Turn back! Lie low, residents*ln of Dedan, for*ln I will bring Esau’s calamity on him at*ln the time I punish him.
If*ln grape harvesters came to you, wouldn’t*ln they leave a few grapes? Were*ln thieves to come in the night, they*ln would destroy only what they wanted.

But*ln I will strip Esau bare; I*ln will uncover his secret places. He*ln will try to hide, but he will be unable. His*ln descendants will be destroyed along*ln with his relatives and neighbors. He*ln will exist no longer.
Abandon*ln your fatherless; I will preserve them; let*ln your widows trust in me.
For*p this is what the Lord*s says: “If those who do not deserve to drink the cup must drink it, can you possibly remain unpunished? You will not remain unpunished, for you must drink it too.

For by myself I have sworn” — this is the Lord’s*s declaration — “Bozrah will become a desolation, a disgrace, a ruin, and an example for cursing, and all its surrounding cities will become ruins forever.”
I*pn have heard an envoy from the Lord;*s a*ln messenger has been sent among the nations: Assemble*ln yourselves to come against her. Rise*ln up for war!
I*pn will certainly make you insignificant among the nations, despised*ln among humanity.

As*ln to the terror you cause, your*ln arrogant heart has deceived you. You*ln who live in the clefts of the rock, you*ln who occupy the mountain summit, though*ln you elevate your nest like the eagles, even*ln from there I will bring you down. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
“Edom*p will become a desolation. Everyone who passes by her will be appalled and scoff because of all her wounds.
As when Sodom and Gomorrah were overthrown along with their neighbors,” says the Lord,*s “no one will live there; no human being will stay in it even temporarily.

“Look,*p it will be like a lion coming from the thickets of the Jordan to the watered grazing land. I will chase Edom away from her land in a flash. I will appoint whoever is chosen for her. For who is like me? Who will issue me a summons? Who is the shepherd who can stand against me?”

Therefore,*p hear the plans that the Lord*s has drawn up against Edom and the strategies he has devised against the people of Teman: The flock’s little lambs will certainly be dragged away, and their grazing land will be made desolate because of them.
At the sound of their fall the earth will quake; the sound of her cry will be heard at the Red Sea.
Look! It will be like an eagle soaring upward, then swooping down and spreading its wings over Bozrah. In that day the hearts of Edom’s warriors will be like the heart of a woman with contractions.
Prophecies against Damascus
About*p Damascus: Hamath*pn and Arpad are put to shame, for*ln they have heard a bad report and are agitated, like*ln the anxious sea that cannot be calmed.
Damascus*ln has become weak; she*ln has turned to run; panic*ln has gripped her. Distress*ln and labor pains have seized her like*ln a woman in labor.
How*ln can the city of praise not be abandoned, the*ln town that brings me joy?
Therefore,*ln her young men will fall in her public squares; all*ln the warriors will perish in that day. This*lg is the declaration of the Lord*s of Armies.
I*pn will set fire to the wall of Damascus; it*ln will consume Ben-hadad’s citadels.
Prophecies against Kedar and Hazor
About*p Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon defeated, this is what the Lord*s says: Rise*pn up, attack Kedar, and*ln destroy the people of the east!

They*ln will take their tents and their flocks along*ln with their tent curtains and all their equipment. They*ln will take their camels for themselves. They*ln will call out to them, “Terror*ln is on every side!”

Run!*ln Escape quickly! Lie low, residents*ln of Hazor — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — for*pn King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon has*ln drawn up a plan against you; he*ln has devised a strategy against you.
Rise*pn up, attack a nation at ease, one*ln living in security. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. They*pn have no doors, not even a gate bar; they*ln live alone.

Their*ln camels will become plunder, and*ln their massive herds of cattle will become spoil. I*ln will scatter them to the wind in every direction, those*ln who clip the hair on their temples; I*ln will bring calamity on them across all their borders. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Hazor*pn will become a jackals’ den, a*ln desolation forever. No*ln one will live there; no*ln human being will stay in it even temporarily.
Prophecies against Elam
This*p is the word of the Lord*s that came to the prophet Jeremiah about Elam at the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah.
This is what the Lord*s of Armies says: I*pn am about to shatter Elam’s bow, the*ln source of their might.

I*ln will bring the four winds against Elam from*ln the four corners of the heavens, and*ln I will scatter them to all these winds. There*ln will not be a nation to*ln which Elam’s banished ones will not go.

I*ln will devastate Elam before their enemies, before*ln those who intend to take their lives. I*ln will bring disaster on them, my*ln burning anger. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. I*pn will send the sword after them until*ln I finish them off.
I*ln will set my throne in Elam, and*ln I will destroy the king and officials from there. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Yet,*pn in the last days, I*ln will restore the fortunes of Elam. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
